page.title: 09WILDLIFE
page.content: Farming is intense, many hedgerows and woods have been removed. Rabbits, hares, pheasants, rats and weasels have adapted to living in these conditions.Flockingh birds such as the crow, starling, sparrow and seagull are seen in our fields and following the plough. The fox, mole, and hedgehog live in fields but are adapting to life in gardens. {Birds}have adapted well to life with man as woodlands reduce they live in our gardens and on our houses. Housemartins and bluetits are typical and are in good numbers, at least 30 other species can be seen. Despite crop sprays 7 species of{butterfly} have been recorded. We must not forget domestic animals dog, cat, pigeon, goose, rabbit, hen, etc. Lets hope all species survive.
